definitions: large impressive house with many rooms typically owned by wealthy individuals
examples: The billionaire lived in a sprawling mansion overlooking the ocean
They converted the old mansion into a boutique hotel

definitions: criminal offense of killing someone without premeditation or intent to murder
examples: The driver was charged with manslaughter after the fatal accident
Involuntary manslaughter carries a lighter sentence than murder charges

definitions: giant flat-bodied fish with wing-like fins that swims by flapping through water
examples: The manta ray glided gracefully through the coral reef
Divers watched the manta feeding on plankton near the surface

definitions: decorative framework around a fireplace including the shelf above it
examples: Family photos were displayed on the wooden mantel
The antique clock sat in the center of the marble mantel

definitions: traditional lace or silk veil worn over the head and shoulders by Spanish women
examples: She wore a black mantilla to the traditional Spanish wedding
The delicate mantilla was passed down through generations of women

definitions: loose sleeveless cloak or shawl worn over other clothes
position of leadership or responsibility passed from one person to another
examples: The wizard wore a dark mantle embroidered with silver stars
Snow covered the mountain like a white mantle
She assumed the mantle of leadership after her mentor retired
The young athlete took on the mantle of team captain

definitions: word or phrase repeated frequently as a guiding principle or meditation aid
examples: Her personal mantra was to always stay positive and focused
The team adopted 'never give up' as their motivational mantra

definitions: book containing detailed instructions for operating equipment or performing tasks
examples: Please consult the manual before assembling the furniture
The software manual explained all the program's features clearly

definitions: building or place where goods are manufactured on a large scale
examples: The old textile manufactory employed hundreds of local workers
They converted the abandoned manufactory into luxury apartments

definitions: process of making goods in factories using machinery and organized labor
examples: The manufacture of electronics requires precision and quality control
They moved their manufacture operations to a larger facility

definitions: animal dung mixed with straw used to enrich soil for growing plants
examples: Farmers spread manure on their fields before planting season
The garden thrived after being treated with organic manure

definitions: handwritten or typed document especially an author's original version before publication
examples: The publisher reviewed her manuscript and offered a book deal
Ancient manuscripts were carefully preserved in the monastery library

definitions: tree with distinctive lobed leaves that produces sweet sap and colorful autumn foliage
examples: The maple tree turned brilliant red and orange in October
They tapped the maple trees to collect sap for syrup

definitions: person who creates maps or charts of geographical areas or data
examples: The mapper carefully documented every street in the new subdivision
Digital mappers use satellite imagery to update navigation systems

definitions: process of making maps or establishing connections between different sets of information
examples: The mapping of the ocean floor revealed underwater mountain ranges
Scientists completed the genetic mapping of the rare species

definitions: disfiguring mark or blemish that spoils the appearance of something
examples: A deep scratch created an ugly mar on the table surface
Nothing could mar the beauty of the perfect sunset

definitions: footrace covering 26.2 miles traditionally run on roads
prolonged or difficult task requiring sustained effort over time
examples: She trained for months to run her first marathon
The city marathon attracted thousands of runners from around the world
The team worked a coding marathon to finish the project
They had a movie marathon watching all eight films

definitions: person who roams around attacking and stealing from people or places
examples: Marauders attacked the village and stole their winter supplies
The castle walls protected residents from bands of marauders

definitions: act of going about in search of things to steal or people to attack
examples: The marauding army left destruction in its wake
Farmers protected their crops from marauding wildlife at night

definitions: hard crystalline metamorphic rock used in sculpture and building that polishes well
small glass or stone ball used in children's games
examples: The statue was carved from a single block of white marble
They installed marble countertops in their newly renovated kitchen
Children played with colorful marbles during recess
He lost his favorite marble in the playground

definitions: person who walks in an organized procession especially for protest or demonstration
examples: Civil rights marchers faced opposition but continued their peaceful protest
The marcher carried a sign demanding environmental protection

definitions: act of walking with regular steps in formation as soldiers or in organized groups
examples: The marching band performed at halftime during the football game
Protesters spent hours marching through the city streets

definitions: adult female horse typically over four years old used for breeding or riding
examples: The mare gave birth to a healthy foal in spring
He rode his favorite mare through the mountain trails

definitions: spreadable food product made from vegetable oils used as a butter alternative
examples: She spread margarine on her toast instead of butter
The recipe called for margarine but butter works too

definitions: cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, and orange liqueur typically served with salt
examples: They ordered frozen margaritas at the Mexican restaurant
The bartender made the perfect margarita with fresh lime juice

definitions: shortened informal term for margarine used in casual conversation
examples: Pass the marge for my morning toast please
She always bought the low-fat marge from the grocery store

definitions: notes written in the margins of a book or document by readers
examples: The ancient text contained fascinating marginalia from medieval scholars
Her marginalia revealed deep insights into the novel's themes

definitions: process of treating a person or group as insignificant or pushing them to society's edge
examples: The study examined the marginalization of immigrant communities
Economic policies led to the marginalization of rural populations

definitions: white daisy-like flower with yellow center commonly grown in gardens
examples: The garden was filled with cheerful white marguerites
She picked a bouquet of marguerites from the meadow

definitions: traditional Mexican musical group featuring violins, trumpets, and guitars in ornate costumes
examples: The mariachi band played romantic songs at the wedding reception
We hired a mariachi group for the Cinco de Mayo celebration

definitions: bright orange or yellow flower commonly planted in gardens to repel insects
examples: She planted marigolds around her vegetable garden
The vibrant marigolds added color to the summer flower bed

definitions: musical instrument with wooden bars struck with mallets to produce melodic tones
examples: The marimba player performed a beautiful solo at the concert
Students learned to play traditional songs on the marimba

definitions: harbor facility with docks and services for recreational boats and yachts
examples: They kept their sailboat at the marina during summer months
The new marina attracted wealthy yacht owners to the area

definitions: person who navigates or works on ships especially as a profession
examples: The old mariner told stories of his adventures at sea
Ancient mariners used the stars to navigate across oceans

definitions: puppet controlled from above by strings or wires attached to its limbs
examples: The marionette danced gracefully as the puppeteer pulled its strings
Children watched the marionette show at the puppet theater

definitions: person who promotes and sells products or services using various advertising strategies
examples: The digital marketer created engaging social media campaigns
Experienced marketers understand consumer behavior and market trends

definitions: physical location where goods are bought and sold by multiple vendors
competitive commercial environment where businesses operate and compete
examples: Vendors sold fresh produce at the outdoor marketplace
The medieval marketplace was the center of town commerce
Small businesses struggle to compete in the global marketplace
New technologies are changing the digital marketplace rapidly

definitions: visible pattern, color, or feature that distinguishes something from its surroundings
examples: The zebra's distinctive markings help it blend with the herd
Road markings guide drivers safely through the intersection

definitions: person skilled in shooting accurately at targets especially with firearms
examples: The marksman hit the bullseye from 100 yards away
Police marksmen were positioned on rooftops during the event

definitions: skill and ability in shooting accurately at targets with precision
examples: Military training emphasized marksmanship and weapon safety
Her excellent marksmanship earned her a spot on the Olympic team

definitions: amount added to cost price to determine selling price for profit
set of tags or codes used to format text in documents
examples: The store applied a 50% markup on all imported goods
Retailers need reasonable markup to cover operating expenses
HTML markup defines the structure of web pages
The editor used markup to indicate formatting changes

definitions: large fast-swimming fish with a spear-like snout prized by sport fishermen
examples: The fisherman struggled for hours to reel in the marlin
Blue marlin can swim at speeds up to 50 miles per hour

definitions: preserve made from citrus fruit especially oranges boiled with sugar and peel
examples: She spread orange marmalade on her English muffin
Homemade marmalade requires patience and the right balance of sweetness

definitions: small long-tailed monkey native to South American forests with clawed digits
examples: The tiny marmoset clung to tree branches in the rainforest
Pygmy marmosets are the world's smallest monkey species

definitions: large ground-dwelling rodent that hibernates in winter and lives in mountainous areas
examples: The marmot whistled to warn others of approaching danger
Alpine marmots emerge from their burrows in early spring

definitions: dark brownish-red color resembling the color of chestnuts
state of being abandoned in an isolated or inaccessible place
examples: She wore a maroon dress to the formal dinner
The school colors were maroon and gold
Pirates would maroon traitors on deserted islands
The shipwreck survivors were marooned for three months

definitions: brand name of a product especially an automobile make or model
examples: The luxury marque is known for its exceptional engineering
Several prestigious marques competed in the vintage car show
